lines.text: This is Assembly Control calling all Zero X units. Assembly Phase One - go!
Say, Tin-Tin, why don't we go off to the mainland tonight? Just the two of us?
That would be lovely, Alan. I'll wear my new dress.

[alarmed]
What goes on around here? Have you all gone crazy? This is International Rescue, remember? You can't leave the base unmanned.

[disappointed]
That's OK, Mr Tracy, I understand.

[annoyed]
Well I don't. I'm going to bed.
But won't you have some coffee, Alan?

[heading for his room]
No thanks! It keeps me awake!
[after one of the lift bodies spirals out of control]
All control systems go. Remote control circuits are dead. Escape unit is... Central Control from Zero-X. Escape Unit circuits are dead!
Dr Grant, Dr Pierce, can you hear me?

Paul. Greg. Brad. Now this is a tough assignment. And if this mission is successful, you will be the first men to land on Mars. This project has been the most costly yet designed by man. However, the safety and security of the crew and and passengers still takes top priority. Is that completely understood? Captain Paul Travers?

[to Paul, Greg and Brad]
OK. Away you go, and good luck.

[to Greg and Brad]
All right, this is it.

[echo]
Mind the gap, Alan. Mind the gap, Alan.

[slowly]
What's the matter, Alan? What's the matter, Alan. Don't tell me you're afraid.
A brave astronaut like you, Alan - afraid.
[Alan jumps off but misses FAB 1, falling to Earth while Penelope laughs]
Are you suggesting sir that we are incapable of handling our own security arrangements? I have 862 pages here sir which say just that.
